results.title: Alien 3
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, David Giler, Gordon Carroll, Walter Hill, Brandywine Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Continuing the “Alien” trilogy, Ripley’s spaceship crash lands into a maximum security work correctional facility, a monastic community, host to some of the most violent criminals in the universe -but she didn’t come alone. Once again Officer Ripley is pitted against her deadliest enemy, only this time without the aid of advanced technology or modern weapons. This video also contains a 26 minute documentary called “The Making of Alien Resurrection”, which is actually the next film in the “series” after “Alien 3”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Fincher, David Giler, Gordon Carroll, Walter Hill, Brandywine Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
results.creator_credit: Jean-Paul Rappeneau, Michel Seydoux, Rene Cleitman, Camera One, D D Productions, Hachette Premiere and UGC Images
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Edmond Rostand, this lavish version of the classic French romance comedy combines the breathtaking wit and poetry of the play with the colour and spectacle of a good costume drama. Gerard Depardieu is perfect as the charismatic Cyrano, whose enormous nose makes him feel unworthy to love his cousin Roxanne (Anne Brochet). When Roxanne confesses her love for handsome young cadet Christian de Neuvillette (Vincent Perez), Cyrano becomes a reluctant conduit for his love when he becomes the ‘voice’ for the inarticulate Christian. Soon Roxanne has fallen in love with Christian’s handsome looks, but also with the passionate poetry of his soul, which she doesn’t realise is Cyrano. In French with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of 1991 Academy Award for Best Costume Design and 1991 Golden Globe for Best Foreign Film)

results.title: Lost in space
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hopkins, Akiva Goldsman, Carla Fay, Mark W Koch and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: In the not too distant future, earth is on the verge of total collapse and survival lies on colonising outer space. All hope rests on the Robinson family, whose mission is to establish life on Alpha Prime, the only other habitable planet in the galaxy. However when their spacecraft is sabotaged by a traitor, they find themselves lost in space and flying headlong into some out of this world dangers. Cast includes William Hurt, Gary Oldman, Matt LeBlanc, Mimi Rogers, Heather Graham and Lacey Chabert.

results.title: The Goonies
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Harvey Bernhard and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: When a group of greedy developers decide to demolish the headquarters of the Goonies- a group of adventurous youngsters, it seems that the gang will have to disband. By pure coincidence they they encounter a 17th century pirate map and set out on an adventure to locate the treasure and raise the necessary money to save the property. It quickly becomes apparent that they aren’t the only people interested in the treasure, when they cross paths with a group of criminals. The Goonies start to live up to their adventurous mission more than ever when they enter a fabulous subterranean world and are forced into a series of events that could mean the difference between life, death, and the future of their home. Cast includes Sean Astin, Josh Brolin, Jeff Cohen, Corey Feldman and Martha Plimpton.

results.title: I Know what you did last summer
results.creator_credit: Jim Gillespie, Eric Feig, Neal H. Moritz, Stokely Chaffin and Mandalay Entertainment
results.brief_description: Following their graduation, friends Julie, Helen, Ray and Barry get into Barry’s new BMW and head for the beach to celebrate the end of an important chapter in their lives. This sudden decision leads them on a path which will change their lives inexorably when they accidentally hit a pedestrian on deserted road. After the initial shock of what has happened has abated, they decide to toss the evidence, his body- into the ocean and swear secrecy to the event ever taking place. A year passes, the friendships have deteriorated, and strange things begin to happen. An anonymous note saying “I know what you did last summer” brings the accident on the road to life again, forcing the four friends to wonder whether someone has broken the promise of secrecy, or whether there was someone else on the road that day. Based on the novel by Lois Duncan. Screenplay by Kevin Williamson. Cast includes Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr, and Anne Heche.

results.title: Dead letter office
results.creator_credit: John Ruane, Andrew Knight, Deb Cox, Denise Patience, Steve Vizard and Artist Services
results.brief_description: In the dead letter office sit thousands of fading dreams which didn’t reach the recipient because they were insufficiently addressed. One batch of letters are signed by “your bundle of joy”, a young girl named Alice who writes regular letters to her absent father but keeps having them returned with the dead letter office stamp. Alice, now a young woman, begins a job with the dead letter office to continue searching for her father. Once there she encounters a box labelled “special cases”, a sealed collection of letters that the dead letter office doesn’t hold much hope for locating the recipient. Alice is drawn to these scribes like herself and becomes drawn into the misery of others, although her passion for these cases causes conflict amongst the other workers. The office is an odd assortment of employees, headed by manager Frank (George DelHoyo), a political refugee from Chile. Alice and Frank are drawn to each other and after appreciating one another’s dreams and tortured backgrounds, a tentative relationship develops in the most unlikeliest of settings. Cast includes Miranda Otto, George DelHoya, Nicholas Bell, Georgina Naidu, Syd Brisbane and Barry Otto.

results.title: Twin Peaks. Pilot episode
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, David J. Llatt, Frost Productions and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: What happened to Laura Palmer? This became one of pop culture’s most discussed questions when this pilot for David Lynch’s “Twin Peaks” was first aired on television. Kyle MacLachlan plays FBI agent Dale Cooper who comes into the sleepy small-town Twin Peaks to investigate Laura Palmer’s murder and discovers that underneath the banal facade the town hides a labyrinth of perversity and evil. As with “Eraserhead” and “Blue Velvet”, Lynch uses macabre humour to expose the psychological neurosis and psychosis that underlie the supposed normality of middle-class America. Both wickedly funny and savagely shocking, “Twin Peaks” radicalised the potential of the TV mini-series by introducing generic forms and psychological content that had previously been isolated to independent cinema. This is the initial pilot episode but it also stands alone as a feature film. “Twin Peaks” is a soap opera and police drama as reinterpreted by the leading surrealist of contemporary cinema.

results.title: Midnight in the garden of good and evil
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Arnold Stiefel and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood directed this adaptation of John Berendt’s non-fiction best-seller about a Savannah, Georgia, murder case. As the film begins, New York journalist, John Kelso (John Cusack), arrives in Savannah to do a brief article on the annual Christmas party given by sophisticated, urbane antique dealer, Jim Williams (Kevin Spacey). After the party, Williams kills his violent lover, Billy, explaining it as self defence. Kelso decides to stay in Savannah to cover the trial, encountering a variety of colourful locals and eccentrics. Cast includes Kevin Spacey, John Cusack, Jack Thompson, Alison Eastwood and Jude Law.

results.title: The Lost boys
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Harvey Bernhard and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This popular 1987 film presents an interesting mix of genres: the 1980s teen movie with vampires. Michael and Sam are two brothers who have moved with their mother to Santa Carla, “murder capitol of the world”, unaware of the vampires residing in this fictional Californian Coastal town (the film was shot in Santa Barbara, and includes spectacular footage of the Boardwalk and beach-side amusement park). Michael is charmed by a girl named Star (Jamie Gertz), and immediately falls in with a tough young gang led by David. It’s peer pressure in the extreme as Michael is tricked into drinking blood. He is turned into an unwilling vampire, and Sam looks to a pair of comic book vendors who are well versed in the dealings with vampires, to help save Michael. The insecurities and frustrations of youth are amplified and satirised by this exciting and funny MTV-generation thriller. Cast includes: Jason Patric, Corey Haim, Dianne Wiest, Kiefer Sutherland and Corey Feldman.

results.title: Broken arrow = Blood brothers
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, Julian Blaustein and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1870 white men and Indians are still fighting bitterly. One man, Tom Jeffords (James Stewart), is the lonely voice of conscience on the frontier, and strongly believes the Apaches are being treated unfairly. He befriends their leader Cochise (Jeff Chandler), and the two become friends as they forge negotiations to reach a truce. During this process Jeffords is called upon by a U.S. Army general to negotiate a government peace treaty, which he does successfully. The treaty comes at a high price however, when Jeffords, his Indian wife, and friend Cochise become targets of a renegade ambush. Based on the novel “Blood brother” by Elliott Arnold. Cast includes James Stewart, Jeff Chandler, Debra Paget and Basil Ruysdael.
